Year: 1999
Country: Czech Republic
Genre: Romance, Drama
Duration: 92 min.

Russian subtitles: yes


Director: Karel Kachyna

Starring: Lada Jelinkova, Miro Noga, Jiri Ornest, Tatana Fischerova, Milan Lasica, Hanus Bor, Vaclav Chalupa, Stanislav Zindulka, Jean Kraus, Eva Golubova

Description: This film is about love, faith, family, and the difficulty of selecting removed from a story by Ivan Olbrakht "Sad eyes Hana Karadzic." Events occur in Sub-Carpathian Ukraine in the 1930s in an enclave of religious Jews Polyana village, strictly adhering to the ancient rituals and traditions. After Hanna family is ruined, and the girl without a dowry can not count on a happy marriage, she joins a group of young Zionists and went to work in the city. There, she falls in love with a successful free-thinking Jew Ivo Karadzic, who refused to traditional religious faith. But the family of Hanna strongly against her marriage with a man. And Hanna is forced to make a choice between the man she fell in love, and faith in which she was raised.

Extras. Information:
15.11.2000
The largest in the UK Jewish Film Festival opened wide showing of the film, shot by Czech filmmakers of Jewish shtetl life at the dawn of the twentieth century. "Hanna," a film makers who some critics accused of excessive pedaling stereotypical images, develops the story of the destruction of the traditional Jewish family, the father lets her daughter in her desire to marry a non-Jew.
